Class UserProfile

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.UserProfile

public class UserProfile
extends CWScriptable

Collection of static methods that work with the user profile data

          Set Endpoint URL for interface call overriding the port configuration It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: Any value set will be ignored by Global.generateInterfaceMessage().

getHttpResponseHeaderMap

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getHttpResponseHeaderMap()
Deprecated. As of 6.0. Use UserProfile.getHttpResponseHeaderNames() and UserProfile.getHttpResponseHeaderValue()

Returns a "cwf:propertyMap" datastructure object representing the HTTP RESPONSE headers from the last HTTP interface operation invoked with the current user context. Header or property values are Arrays to support multi-valued headers. Example HTTP response headers: HTTP/1.0 200 OK HEADER_1: VALUE_1 HEADER_2: VALUE_2 HEADER_3: VALUE_3_1, VALUE_3_2 HEADER_4: VALUE_4_1 HEADER_4: VALUE_4_2 XML representation of corresponding datastructure: HEADER_1 VALUE_1 HEADER_2 VALUE_2 HEADER_3 VALUE_3_1, VALUE_3_2 HEADER_4 VALUE_4_1 VALUE_4_2

getHttpResponseHeaderNames

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] getHttpResponseHeaderNames()
Gets the names of all response property names. For the HTTP interface response properties are the HTTP response header names. Not supported for other service providers. Properties are kept in the user context and cleared before each new interface invocation. Properties for a given interface invocation are gauranteed to be available immediately following the invocation or in the after script of a direct invocation by the process engine.

Returns:
Request property names.
Since:
6.0

getHttpResponseHeaderValue

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] getHttpResponseHeaderValue(String name)
Return the response property values for a given property name. See UserProfile.getHttpResponseHeaderNames().

Returns:
Request URL parameter names.
Since:
6.0

getLanguage

public static String getLanguage()
Returns current language code.

Returns:
Language code (ie en-ca).

getLoginParam

public static String getLoginParam(String name)
Gets login URL parameter. For example: given URL "http://localhost:8080/cwf?startPage=news", the parameter can be retrieved by _getLoginParam("startPage").

Parameters:
name - Login URL parameter name.
Returns:
Login URL parameter value.

getMsgData

public static Array getMsgData()
Gets additional message data that is available for the last message received by an external interface in the current user context. Also removes message data from the context.

Returns:
Interface specific data. MQ, JMS: Pairs of entries representing name and values of message properties. HTTP: Pairs of entries representing name and values of HTTP headers. For Listeners, it is the request headers. For HTTP Clients, it is the response headers. SOAP, FTP, SMTP, LDAP, DB, TIBCO, JS, JAVA: Not used.

getMsgLogDoc

public static CwObject getMsgLogDoc()
Gets the last Message Log entry created in the current user context. If no interface configured to log messages was invoked in this context the value will be null. Message log entries are automatically created when messages are sent (outgoing - external interface) or received (incoming - listeners) and the 'Log message' flag is configured for the corresponding operation. Entries can also be created by setMsgLogDoc(msgLogDoc)

Returns:
Message log entry

getMsgLogId

public static java.lang.Long getMsgLogId()
Deprecated. use getMsgLogDoc()

Gets Id of the last Message Log entry created in the current user context. If no interface configured to log messages was invoked in this context the value will be zero.

Returns:
Message log Id

Parameters:
participant - Participant metadata name.
Returns:
Array of pairs of participant operation name and label

Returns:

getProcess

public static Process getProcess()
Returns:
current running process object. If the context is not a PE context, return null.

getRequestParam

public static String getRequestParam(String name)
Gets request URL parameter. For example: given URL "http://localhost:8080/cwf?startPage=news", the parameter can be retrieved by getRequestParam("startPage"). Can be used in the context of a UI script or HTTP Listener script. In the case of parameters that have multiple values, the first value is returned. For UI Scripts: Parameters are kept in a map and each new request, if it has parameters, replaces parameters with the same name with new values, as opposed to login parameters, which are only populated when login action is performed. So, request parameters are cumulative (until cleared). Use clearRequestParams() method to clear Please note that request parameters are disabled by default. They must be enabled in config, "System tab" / "Enable Request Parameters" For HTTP Listener script: Parameters are cleared from the context at the end of processing for each request.

Parameters:
name - request URL parameter name.
Returns:
Request URL parameter value.

getRequestParamNames

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] getRequestParamNames()
Gets names of all request URL parameters. For example: given URL "http://localhost:8080/cwf?startPage=news", will return an array containing "startPage" Parameters are kept in a map and each new request, if it has parameters, replaces parameters with the same name with new values, as opposed to login parameters, which are only populated when login action is performed. So, request parameters are cumulative (until cleared). Use clearRequestParams() method to clear Please note that request parameters are disabled by default. They must be enabled in config, "System tab" / "Enable Request Parameters"

Returns:
Request URL parameter names.

getRequestParamValues

public static String[] getRequestParamValues(String name)
For use in HTTP Listener Scripts only. Returns parameter values in the form of a String array whether or not there are 1 or more values. If the parameter wasn't in the request, NULL is returned.

Parameters:
name - HTTP Request Parameter name.
cx -
Returns:
Array of String values when used within an HTTP Listener Script. NULL otherwise.

getRequestPath

public static String[] getRequestPath()
For use in HTTP Listener Scripts only.

Returns the path, any URL path after the operation.

Returns:
Array of Strings representing a break down of the request path.

getUPSegment

public static Document getUPSegment(String name)
Gets an UP segment record.

Parameters:
name - The fully qualified metadata segment document name.
Returns:
The segment document from the database. If the document name is correct but the document is not in the database returns new initialized document. If the name is not an UP segment name returns null.

                         String password)
Logs user into the system. May only be called from login document.

Parameters:
userId - User ID.
password - Password.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if invalid login

logout

public static void logout()
Logs user out of the system. Note that logout is irreversible and login may NOT be called afterwards.

pauseQueue

public static void pauseQueue(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer delay)
Suspend message processing on the current queue. Should be called within message processing script for JMS, MQ & Tibco listeners only. Listener will stop dequeuing message for duration specified.

Parameters:
delay - Number of second to delay message processing

revertToSelf

public static void revertToSelf()
Stops impersonation of another user.

rollbackMessage

public static void rollbackMessage(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer redelivery)
Rollback current message. Should be called within message processing script for JMS listeners only.

Parameters:
redelivery - Number of seconds after message should be processed again

selectApp

public static void selectApp()
Go to the page for selecting the available applications

                                   String group,

setHttpResponseCode

public static void setHttpResponseCode(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer response_code)
Sets the HTTP response code which will be used in http responses handled by HTTP listeners (Binding Type HTTP). If not set by a user script, HTTP listeners normally set it to 200 for successful requests.

Please note that the HTTP response codes set by this method can be overwritten by the listener in the event of any exception.

Usual uses for HTTP response codes:

  • 1xx: Informational - Request received, continuing process
  • 2xx: Success - The action was successfully received, understood, and accepted
  • 3xx: Redirection - Further action must be taken in order to complete the request
  • 4xx: Client Error - The request contains bad syntax or cannot be fulfilled
  • 5xx: Server Error - The server failed to fulfil an apparently valid request

Reference: http://www.iana.org/assignments/http-status-codes/http-status-codes.xhtml

Parameters:
int - representing the http response code to be used with HTTP Api http responses. Passing 0 resets behaviour.
Since:
6.0

setInterfaceConversionMap

public static void setInterfaceConversionMap(String conversionMap)
Set outgoing conversion map name for interface call. It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.generateInterfaceMessage() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: The conversion map is used by Global.generateInterfaceMessage() in creation of the message text, so calls to any method to send the generated message will not require and ignore any value set for the conversion map. Value will be cleared immediately after execution of any of the above methods. 2) In the cwOnProcActBefore script of an Interface Activity in a process. Value will be cleared immediately after the execution of cwOnProcActBefore.

Parameters:
conversionMap -

setInterfaceHeaders

public static void setInterfaceHeaders(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object headers)
Set header information for interface call. It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.generateInterfaceMessage() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: The SOAP provider will ignore headers when Global.sendInterfaceMessage(), Global.sendInterfaceMessageUsePE() and Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() are used. This is because the headers will be used by Global.generateInterfaceMessage(). Value will be cleared immediately after execution of any of the above methods. 2) In the cwOnProcActBefore script of an Interface Activity in a process. Value will be cleared immediately after the execution of cwOnProcActBefore.

Parameters:
headers - HTTP Clients: Data object (Document or Datastructure) whose immediate children/leaves will be used to set HTTP headers. SOAP Clients: Array of data objects that MAY be used in conjunction with the metadata binding Input parameter "header" to generate soap headers. If no metadata parameter is specified, all data objects provided will be used as SOAP headers. If the "header" parameter is specified in metadata, only the first data object MAY be used to generate a SOAP header (Please see the metadata documentation for SOAP bindings for a description of the "header" parameter). The rest will be ignored.

setInterfaceLocation

public static void setInterfaceLocation(String location)
Set Endpoint URL for interface call overriding the port configuration It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: Any value set will be ignored by Global.generateInterfaceMessage(). Value will be cleared immediately after execution of any of the above methods. 2) In the cwOnProcActBefore script of an Interface Activity in a process. Value will be cleared immediately after the execution of cwOnProcActBefore.

Parameters:
location -

setInterfacePassword

public static void setInterfacePassword(String password)
Set authentication password for interface call overriding the port configuration field "HTTP Password" for those service providers that support it. It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: Any value set will be ignored by Global.generateInterfaceMessage(). Value will be cleared immediately after execution of any of the above methods. 2) In the cwOnProcActBefore script of an Interface Activity in a process. Value will be cleared immediately after the execution of cwOnProcActBefore.

Parameters:
password -

public static void setInterfaceUser(String user)
Set authentication user name for interface call overriding the port configuration field "HTTP User" for those service providers that support it. It is only valid to use this method: 1) Prior to invocation of an interface in the same scripting context via the following methods: Global.invokeInterface() Global.invokeInterfaceUsePE() Global.sendInterfaceMessage() Process.sendMessageToQueue() Process.sendStringMessageToQueue() NOTE: Any value set will be ignored by Global.generateInterfaceMessage(). Value will be cleared immediately after execution of any of the above methods. 2) In the cwOnProcActBefore script of an Interface Activity in a process. Value will be cleared immediately after the execution of cwOnProcActBefore.

Parameters:
user -

setMsgLogData

public static void setMsgLogData(String data1,
                                 String data2,
                                 String data3,
                                 java.lang.Long mid)
Deprecated. Use setMsgLogDoc(msgLogDoc) to set a new doc into the context. To update the message log entry from AFTER the last external interface call in this context, use getMsgLogDoc() combined with Document.save() if you wish to update the record in the database.

Updates 'user data' fields in message log. If message id is not specified or is zero, the last message log created in current user context will be updated in memory or a new document will be created. If id is greater than zero, than the record in the database will be directly updated.

Parameters:
data1 - string, should not exceed 64 characters
data2 - string, should not exceed 64 characters
data3 - string, should not exceed 64 characters
mid - Message id to update.

setMsgLogDoc

public static void setMsgLogDoc(CwObject document)
Store a message log document in the current request. If not set by a user script, External interface operations and listeners will automatically create a document and store it in the context if the corresponding operation is configured to do so. If configured to log messages, external interface operations and listeners will automatically save the document when the operation completes normally or with an error. Ordercare will automatically set a message ID into the document after the interface is invoked. It MUST NOT be set by the application script. Since there is no key the document MUST NOT be saved prior to invocation of the interface.

Parameters:
document - cwf.messageLog document object.

setUserAvailable

public static void setUserAvailable(String user,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean available)
Updates user available status for worklist distribution.

Parameters:
user - User ID.
available - availability flag (true/false).

setUserLanguage

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean setUserLanguage(String languageName)
Sets language for this user context.

Parameters:
languageName - The language code as defined by ISO
Returns:
True if valid language is specified and the language is successfully replaced. False if language is not valid but the language is replaced with default language. Please note that after calling this API, user must refresh the page to re-enter the application to let the the language change take effect.

Returns:
Current user ID.
